column4: Hi.  If I install the beta version of Fiesty, do I have to do a fresh install of the final version, or can I simply download and install the patches from the repository?
you can install the patches and upgrades from beta
and this means I don't need to wipe the drive and do a fresh install, right?
right. if you install the feisty beta, you'll get updates just like normal, that will take you to stable
So is there much performance difference between Ubuntu server and a minimal debian install, on a lower end machine?
hmmm. really, the only differences, are ubuntu services are not listening for connections, and the repos are setup differently
hardware-wise, i think they are similar in support
ubuntu server does give you a lamp stack though. not sure about debian. i think you have to set up lamp yourself...

The only reason I'm asking is I'm searching for a lite distro that will run on my old pen 150 with 32mb of ram (the lack of ram is the killer).  I only want to use this machine for extra storage.  What do you think?
with only 32mb of ram? then you'll *definitely* have to install server, and even at that, you're going to be hurting. i'd probably either look into damn small linux, or upgrading your ram
I tried DSL, but cannot get it to boot even in low memory mode!
heh. i'd upgrade the ram, then
32mb is just not enough, even for the most barebones install
